column4: Industrial equipment maker Hillenbrand to buy Milacron in $2 billion deal
column5: (Reuters) - Industrial equipment maker Hillenbrand Inc HI.N on Friday agreed to buy plastics-processing equipment maker Milacron Holdings Corp MCRN.N in a cash and stock deal valued at about $2 billion, the companies said.
column6: Hillenbrand’s $18.07 per share offer represents about 33.6% premium to Milacron’s closing price on Thursday. Milacron shares jumped 23% to $17.05 in before the opening bell.
column7: The acquisition expands Hillenbrand’s portfolio into plastics technology and processing by adding technologies such as injection molding and extrusion, the company said.
column8: The deal will also expand Hillenbrand’s reach in markets including construction, consumer packaging, automotive, electronics, medical and recycling.
column9: The combined company is expected to generate annual revenue of about $3 billion and free cash flow of more than $325 million by 2021.
column10: The deal, which is expected to close in the first quarter of 2020, includes net debt of about $686 million.
column11: Milacron, which traces its history to 1860 as a screw shop, had filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection of its businesses in 2009.
column12: J.P. Morgan Securities LLC advised Hillenbrand on the deal, while Barclays served as adviser to Milacron.
